Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Enhance hijack functional tests" (#7363) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
`Id:"{id}"`
`Id:"{id}" version:"{version}"`

Consider combinations of: `luceneQuery`, `prerelease`, `semVerLevel`, `ignoreFilter`, `skip`, `take`

`q=id:{id} version:{version}&ignoreFilter=true&semVerLevel=1.0.0` may behave differently between Azure Search and old search. This is okay because gallery always sends `semVerLevel=2.0.0`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Investigate normalization of versions for version:" (#7362) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: I think this may be necessary for hijacking.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[GitHub Usage] Add telemetry to the GitHubIndexer Job" (#7359) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Add the following metrics for telemetry.

per repo:
	totalDuration
	findDuration --> numberOfFiles
	checkoutDuration --> numberOfFiles
 
totalSearchDuration --> totalReposCount
	
Example telem: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Jobs/blob/master/src/Monitoring.RebootSearchInstance/TelemetryService.cs

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Status] Make it easy to identify deployed code" (#7358) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
It is difficult to identify what source code is deployed to the status service.

### Solution
The Gallery puts the commit hash in an HTML comment. Azure Search has "deployment label" and puts commit hash in `/search/diag` endpoint.

### Pending work

* [ ] Expose the commit hash somewhere (like an HTML comment)
* [ ] Add a deployment label to trace back to the deployment's build

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Move search timeout from HttpClient to Polly timeout policy" (#7356) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
When a timeout occurs, consider this as an error for the circuit breaker.
Progress on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7119

Previously everyone would always encounter the timeout case on USNC and the circuit breaker would never open.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test:  tests not cleaning up" (#8363) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Test:  .NET Core SDK 1.1.1 is failing to install on macOS" (#8362) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
.NET Core SDK 1.1.1 install is failing in our CI pipeline on macOS.  .NET Core 1.* has reached [end of life status](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-core); maybe that has something to do with it.

Example:
```
dotnet-install: Downloading link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/1.1.11/dotnet-sdk-1.1.11-osx-x64.tar.gz
curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 404 Not Found
dotnet-install: Cannot download: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/1.1.11/dotnet-sdk-1.1.11-osx-x64.tar.gz
dotnet-install: Downloading legacy link: https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/1.1.11/dotnet-dev-osx-x64.1.1.11.tar.gz
dotnet-install: Extracting zip from https://dotnetcli.azureedge.net/dotnet/Sdk/1.1.11/dotnet-dev-osx-x64.1.1.11.tar.gz
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test:  scripts/funcTests/runFuncTests.sh fails on macOS" (#8361) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
[This commit](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/6bbf84b17503b7c3de15edb5b639457e92cc402e) introduced an error in scripts/funcTests/runFuncTests.sh.  Example:
```
Cleaning TMP directory
rm: /tmp/dotnet.*: No such file or directory
rm: -rf: No such file or directory
=================
/Users/buildagent/agent/_work/32/s/cli/dotnet msbuild build/build.proj /t:Restore /p:VisualStudioVersion=15.0 /p:Configuration=Release /p:BuildNumber=1 /p:ReleaseLabel=beta
/Users/buildagent/agent/_work/32/s/scripts/funcTests/runFuncTests.sh: line 80: /Users/buildagent/agent/_work/32/s/cli/dotnet: No such file or directory
Restore failed!!
##[error]/bin/bash failed with return code: 1
##[error]Bash failed with error: /bin/bash failed with return code: 1
```
The reason is that the syntax for the `rm` command puts options before file/directory paths.  Linux is lenient and allows options after paths but macOS is not.

CC @donnie-msft

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test:  NuGet.Protocol.Plugins.Tests.PluginProcessTests.FilePath_WithExitedProcess_Throws is flaky" (#8360) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
`NuGet.Protocol.Plugins.Tests.PluginProcessTests.FilePath_WithExitedProcess_Throws` is flaky.
```
NuGet.Protocol.Plugins.Tests.PluginProcessTests.FilePath_WithExitedProcess_Throws [FAIL]
  Assert.Throws() Failure
  Expected: typeof(System.Exception)
  Actual:   (No exception was thrown)
  Stack Trace:
    C:\git\NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.Tests\NuGet.Protocol.Tests\Plugins\PluginProcessTests.cs(80,0): at NuGet.Protocol.Plugins.Tests.PluginProcessTests.<>c.<FilePath_WithExitedProcess_Throws>b__7_0(PluginProcess pluginProcess)
    C:\git\NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.Tests\NuGet.Protocol.Tests\Plugins\PluginProcessTests.cs(167,0): at NuGet.Protocol.Plugins.Tests.PluginProcessTests.TestWithExitedProcess(Action`1 verify)
    C:\git\NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.Tests\NuGet.Protocol.Tests\Plugins\PluginProcessTests.cs(80,0): at NuGet.Protocol.Plugins.Tests.PluginProcessTests.FilePath_WithExitedProcess_Throws()
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How do I ignore satellite assembly when publishing?" (#8359) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
@Nirmal4G commented on [Fri Jul 19 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/1549)

I want to reduce the my size of my published project. For local testing, I don't need all the language specific resources, just the neutral version is more than enough. I also test them manually by removing and adding language specific resources when the project is running!

So, How do I ignore the language folders from NuGet `PackageReference`?

---
#### Document Details

âš  *Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com âžŸ GitHub issue linking.*

* ID: ff707668-94d6-25a5-9139-b18cc1b6b446
* Version Independent ID: 494847b9-4894-0beb-7ffa-39a2359999fa
* Content: [NuGet PackageReference format (package references in project files)](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/package-references-in-project-files)
* Content Source: [docs/consume-packages/Package-References-in-Project-Files.md](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/blob/master/docs/consume-packages/Package-References-in-Project-Files.md)
* Product: **nuget**
* GitHub Login: @karann-msft
* Microsoft Alias: **karann**

---

@karann-msft commented on [Sat Jul 20 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/1549#issuecomment-513368000)

@Nirmal4G this is more of a product question. Can you file an issue on the Home repo - https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/new
For future reference, use the send feedback for product button to file such issues. 

---

@Nirmal4G commented on [Sat Jul 20 2019](https://github.com/NuGet/docs.microsoft.com-nuget/issues/1549#issuecomment-513439224)

In any case, there should be docs section explaining those scenarios.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Having "manage nuget packages for solution" window open extremely slows down package upgrades" (#8358) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Checkout https://github.com/pasisavolainen/Teshtink/commit/a16a6485dfc9adf550415445cc1109e52c6d0cb6 Open "nullextension-benchmark.sln" "manage nuget packages for solution" on solution. Go to "Update", elect to update all packages. Restoration will be extremely slow until the "Nuget - Solution" window is closed. _This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/347755/having-manage-nuget-packages-for-solution-window-o.html VSTS ticketId: 695301_ _These are the original issue comments:_ Nikolche Kolev [MSFT] on 7/1/2019, 01:18 PM (18 days ago):

Hello,

Thanks for filing this issue.
| just want to confirm that we understand this scenario fully.

To me initially this sounded like a duplicate of https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6010

Can you please clarify what you mean by restoration is too slow? Is it the update initiated restore thatâ€™s slow and takes a while, or is it you running an update, thne going back to coding and running a restore thatâ€™s slow?

Please be as specific as possible.

Thank you!

Use these instructions to respond to More Info requests from Visual Studio: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio-2017?view=vs-2017#when-further-information-is-needed-need-more-info.

 _These are the original issue solutions:_ (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Get-Project â€“All | Add-BindingRedirect doesn't work when using PackageReference" (#7432) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm trying to add the binding redirects into my app.config, so I'm running the following command:

`Get-Project â€“All | Add-BindingRedirect`
or
`Get-Project 'MyProjectName' | Add-BindingRedirect`
or
`Add-BindingRedirect 'MyProjectName'`

However, these do absolutely nothing.
I believe this is because I'm using PackageReference instead of Package.config.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget.exe restore foo.sln fails if %platform% contains spaces" (#8335) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm not seeing any reference here to nuget.exe relying upon the %platform% enviornment variable: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-environment-variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/tools/cli-ref-environment-variables)

But when I run "nuget.exe restore mysln.sln", and I have %platform" = "Any CPU" (for reasons that have nothing to do with nuget restore), I see "Any CPU" in the error message.

`...\VisualStudio\v16.0\Fakes\Microsoft.QualityTools.Testing.Fakes.targets(13,5): error MSB4184: The expression "System.IO.Path]::Combine(...\, obj\"Any CPU"\Debug\Fakes)" cannot be evaluated. Illegal characters in path.`

Tweets.Text: https://t.co/F9kiKfvqkS is currently degraded and some pages might take too long to load. We are investigating theâ€¦ https://t.co/j3saBGKARZ

We have just published the NuGet Roadmap for Spring 2019. Check it out now! 
https://t.co/gt7qR0S3wV
